reasoning: [Specific Program Not Verified] Paper mentions 'Productive Social Safety Nets (PSSN)' but search could not confirm this as graduation program: Perplexity search result: The Productive Social Safety Nets (PSSN) program in Tanzania is a large-scale national social protection effort aiming to reduce extreme poverty and improve livelihoods through several interventions. It unambiguously provides conditional and unconditional cash transfers through both base payments and public works (cash-for-work) components[1][4][7]. There is strong and consistent evidence that direct cash transfers and employment through public works are core elements of PSSN. However, the graduation status of PSSN is unclear: although some sources mention 'Cash Plus' and pilot enhancements focused on livelihoods, there is no definitive confirmation that PSSN is formally a graduation program according to the standard definition used by organizations like BRAC or J-PAL, nor is there explicit documentation about a systematic, large-scale productive assets transfer component[2][3][7]. Some interventions mention livelihood training, market access, and support, but not direct assets transfer at scale. Therefore, it is unclear whether PSSN includes productive asset provision as a regular component, or qualifies as a graduation program. | Graduation: UNCLEAR, Cash: YES, Assets: UNCLEAR | Confidence: HIGH | Sources: https://clear.dol.gov/Study/Tanzania-Youth-Study-Productive-Social-Safety-Net-PSSN-impact-evaluation-Endline-report-0, https://www.sdgfund.org/case-study/tanzania-joint-programme-support-tanzania%E2%80%99s-productive-social-safety-net, https://transfer.cpc.unc.edu/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/PSNN_Updated.pdf
